items.title: Exclusive: BofA bonuses will jump for investment bankers this year, sources say
items.author: Saeed Azhar, Milana Vinn
items.summary:
- BofA plans bigger bonuses for top investment bankers, with top dealmakers seen ~20% higher amid deal activity.
- It also targets a 50–100 bp rise in IB fee share over 3–5 years and a larger overall M&A bonus pool; discussions ongoing.
- Overall bonuses for traders and investment bankers are expected to rise this year due to deal volume and volatility, possibly the highest since 2021, per Reuters sources.

items.title: Canadian dollar steadies after mixed retail sales data
items.author: Fergal Smith
items.summary: - Canada’s dollar steadied around 1.3775 per US dollar, trading in a 1.3756–1.3801 range as the week ended little changed.\n- October retail sales fell 0.2% MoM after a 0.9% drop in September, with a preliminary November up 1.2%.\n- Oil rose about 1.2% to $56.80 a barrel ahead of possible Russia-Ukraine peace news, with yields higher and the dollar firmer on softer inflation.

items.title: AI boom drives data-center dealmaking to record high, says report
items.author: Reuters
items.summary:
- Data-center dealmaking through Nov 2024 hit a record: over 100 deals, just under $61B, beating the previous high.
- Region totals: US/Canada about $160B since 2019; APAC ~ $40B; Europe ~ $24.2B.
- AI demand and hyperscale builds are driving activity; PE buyers are eager, sellers reluctant, creating tight supply and valuation concerns.

items.title: Germany removes dividend ban for Uniper, paving way for IPO
items.author: Christoph Steitz, Holger Hansen
items.summary: - Germany amends the energy security law to allow Uniper dividends under a narrowly defined exception, easing the path to a future IPO or sale.\n- Berlin owns about 99.12% of Uniper, bailout cost €13.5B, stake valued around €13.8B; EU requires reducing the stake to at least 25%+1 by 2028.\n- Dividends are central to Uniper’s equity story and sale prospects; regulatory scrutiny applies; potential buyers include Brookfield and Daniel Kretinsky.
